summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Delta Airlines, Inc., requesting passenger and other records for Ghislaine Maxwell and two other individuals (names redacted) for two time periods: 1994-1998 and July 2019 onward. It includes a cover letter requesting non-disclosure and a declaration form for the custodian of records.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Judy Gorham
persons.context: Addressee at Delta Airlines, Inc. to whom the subpoena is directed.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: One of the individuals for whom Delta Airlines records are subpoenaed, listed with an alias (Ghislaine Borgerson).

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for Delta Airlines
events.description: Date by which Delta Airlines is commanded to appear before the grand jury or produce requested records.

events.title: Subpoena Issued to Delta Airlines
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office, requesting travel records for specific individuals.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
Federal Bureau of Investigation, 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY 10278
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks Delta Airlines records for Ghislaine Maxwell and two other redacted individuals for two distinct time periods: January 1994 through December 1998, and July 2019 through the date of service (January 2020).

The investigation involves alleged violations of federal criminal laws including 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 1594(c) (conspiracy to commit sex trafficking), 2422(b) (coercion and enticement), and 371 (conspiracy).
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requests Delta Airlines not to disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing grand jury investigation.
The subpoena indicates the investigation was active as of January 2020, focusing on obtaining historical and recent travel records.
